reasoning: Obstructive sleep apnea characterized by apneas (breathing cessation) and hypopneas (reduced breathing). Reported as prevalence rather than incidence (chronic condition). Global prevalence estimated at 9% of adults (~9,000 per 100k). Wide variation by age, sex, and population. Conservative estimate based on multiple population studies.
source: Heinzer R et al. (2015). Prevalence of sleep-disordered breathing in the general population: the HypnoLaus study. Eur Respir J. 45(3):670-679
